alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Northern Livingston; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 9:19PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ascension, southeastern West Baton Rouge, northwestern Livingston, east central Iberville and southeastern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 945 PM CST... At 917 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Plaquemine, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Denham Springs, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Addis, Brusly, Westminster, Old Jefferson, Merrydale, Inniswold, Watson, Village St. George, Shenandoah, Gardere and Greenwell Spring. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 155 and 170. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 21. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. The heavy rain will also reduce visibility on area roadways, including interstates 10, 12 and 110. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Northern Livingston; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension
